text: Black with a creamy tan head. Chocolate, smooth roasted espresso, vanilla, dark malt, slight burnt notes. Full bodied. Lingering bitter espresso finish. So nice.

Sample @ Charleston Brewvival, 2015. Deep brown pour with a large creamy tan head. Plenty of roasted coffee. Some dark chocolate. Rich honeyed chess cookies, too. Big, creamy yet dry body supports some dark malt and more chocolate. Soft bitterness. Well balanced stuff that drinks elegantly. GF have done well here.

22-ounce bottle pours very dark brown with dark tan, foamy head. Aroma: coffee, dark chocolate, dried dark fruits, smoke. Flavor: all of the above, plus dark brown sugar and a lingering espresso and hop bitter-dryness. Mouthfeel: full-bodied, creamy, lush, savory,

A: Pitch black with a thick tan head
N: Massive hit of cappuccino and chocolate. Caramel. 
T: Bitter, more so from the coffee than the hops. Again that caramel note, with hints of fudge. Finishes remarkably dry. 
P: Medium
O: This is what a coffee beer is all about. Still a beer, but with the coffee contributing a good deal.

660ml bottle: Pours a really dark brown, almost black. Thin tan head. Big coffee notes with slight aroma of dark chocolate. Slight alcohol warmth with a roasty notes from the malt. Coffee flavours some through. Medium bitterness, medium carbonation, fullish body. Overall the beer is okay but dont like the astringency.
This is one of the very few beers that has a strong molasses character that I like. The coffee is kind of muted, but the overall Flavors outstanding.

Bottle. It poured a dark brown color with a tan head. The aroma was of dark roast and coffee. The taste was similar to the aroma with more dark roast, coffee, chocolate and some lasting sweetness. Not bad.

Bouteille. Le liquide nest pas foncé. La robe semble noir certes, mais dès quon incline un tant soit peu le verre, on remarque bien que le liquide est clair et bien filtré. Mousse correcte. Nez sucré où le sirop dérable côtoie la vanille française dans un élan de complicité. Des notes de pain grillé ainsi que de café fort sajoutent à cet intense bouquet. Ça demeure équilibré mais très plein. Sucre résiduel important en bouche malgré une assez faible densité. Beaucoup de café froid à lattaque précédent une longue amertume en fin de bouche qui finit par me lasser. Une bière intense aux arômes et saveurs intéressantes mais qui manque de finition au palais.

Draft to taster at The Pint Room. Looks good; a translucent cola with foamy beige head. Smells malty with a nice balance of cocoa and coffee. Tastes like it smells with a pleasantly bitter medium-bodied mouthfeel. A good example of the style.
Bottle from crafty bottle Lincoln. Deep chestnut coffee colour with a foamy tan head. Aroma is big coffee and chocolate. Taste is choc bitter mid sweet. Rich full body.
Bottle at home from Hippo Beers in Glasgow. Very dark. Off white head. Heavy coffee.

Dark brown, nearly black, with a tan creamy head. Aroma of fresh ground coffee and chocolate. Moderate bitterness, fairly dry on the palate. Brilliant coffee and chocolate flavors on the palate. Really an incredible beer.
Awesome slightly sweet. dark fruits, espresso and roasted malt character . Light body, tons of dark fruit and rum and dark chocolate character. Lingering rum and dark chocolate finish. Decadent

Bottle thanks to Wingmane, shared at Matteos leaving drinks. It pours hazy dark brown - black with a small beige head. The aroma is sweet, roasted malts, big espresso coffee character, cacao, quite jammy, dried fruits and wood. The taste is bitter - sweet, roasted malt, plenty of sweet coffee, earthy, chocolate, touch of vanilla, toasty, slick and charred wood. Medium+ body, fine carbonation and foamy mouth-feel. Maybe a touch sweet, but decent enough anyhow.

(Draught) Pours an opaque black body with a medium tan head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malt, chocolate, and caramel. Flavor of coffee, vanilla, chocolate, roasted malt, light pine, and caramel with a dry finish.

This bottled brew from a bottle shop was served at a cool temperature and poured a head of foamy finely sized light brown colored bubbles that were long lasting and left behind a typically carbonated body opaque dark black brown colored body and a thick foamy lacing. The weak aroma was brown malt. The mouth feel was weakly tingly at the start and at the finish malty aftertaste. The ok flavor contained notes of cocoa roasted malt mild hops coffee and brown malt. An OK brew just nothing special.

Creamy beige head stayed well on a near black still body - looks tremendous! 
Strong coffee, porter & dark fruit aroma. 
Medium bodied - smooth, creamy & a clean crisp aft. 
Bitter burnt coffee, roasted notes, plum, grape & stone fruit followed by a slightly hoppy, long finish. Throughout all of this theres hints of demerara sugar!

February 2017 - Bottle share at CBC Islington for the Matteo Farewell tasting, as Green Flash Cosmic Ristretto. Big thanks to Dave! Pours opaque black with a foamy beige head, leaving full lacing. Aroma is coffee, earthy, fudgey, coffee-flavoured sweets. Body is smooth with soft carbonation. Taste has more coffee-flavoured sweets, boiled sweets, earthy finish. Decent. (3.6)

66cl bottle shared at my Farewell Tasting, London. Massive thanks to Dave for this one. It pours a dark ruby color wth a medium beige head. Aroma is sweet syrupy rich with notes of vanilla and milk chocolate. Taste is also sweet syrupy with notes of coconut, vanilla, chocolate and caramel. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, nice one
Tap at Brick Store Pub, Decatur. Colour is almost black with small slighty brownish head. Aromas and flavours: Coffee, chocolate and roasted malts. Pretty basic porter but nice drinkability.
Bottle at Matteo caio tasting Craft Islington. Black beer lasting tan head. Decent coffee dark malts. Some expresso. Quite dry. Ok .

Bottle shared at the CBC Islington for the Matteo farewell tasting. Many thanks to Daniel for this one. A mostly clear dark brown chestnut coloured pour with a loose tan head. Aroma is woody coffee, ashy, praline, brown sugars. Flavour is composed of of woody sugars, toffee, praline, coconut. Woody roast. Palate is medium sweet, woody, maple, bacon. Moderate carbonation. Lingering woody roast.

Bottle: Dark brown color, nearly black, with an ample tan head. Bits of web lacing. Aromatic, light roast and rich espresso notes. The espresso is definitely the mainstay; light bittersweet cocoa and roast, but mostly a rich espresso goodness. Medium to light bodied. Up front I was hoping for more of the Baltic porter influence, but as an espresso beer fan this is quite delicious as is.

Black body, tan spongy head. Lush, fruity, chocolatey coffee aroma  not overly roasted nor burnt. The nose is full of juicy cherries, red apple and a dusting of cinnamon. Pleasant and more intriguing than your typical coffee porter. On the tongue it maintains that same fullness of flavor. Buttery, chewy, meaty, with bursts of cranberry and a smooth finish that evokes coffee and crème brûlée. Delicious and balanced, Green Flash have managed to contain a style that can often veer towards burnt bitterness or sticky syrupiness. The finish is somewhat brief, but otherwise an eminently drinkable brew that I could see becoming my go-to in this genre.

bottle shared that poured dark brown to black with mocha head. the initial aroma was a Baltic porter style with sweet roasted malts, coffee and some chocolate. the first sip I was sold. solid creamy texture with lots of flavors let this one warm up to experience all of the espresso, chocolate and malts blended so nicely together. totally delicious now I need more.

Bottles shared at Murphys Law. Black with a small tan head. Aroma of big espresso, caramel, fudge, toffee and dark chocolate. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and heavy bitter. Light full bodied with soft carbonation.

66cl bottle shared with kermis and 2 friends. 
Coffee aroma. Thin ring tan head. Clear black pour. Lots of coffee. Very nice indeed

Bottle from 7-11: Poured an opaque dark coffee brown liquid topped with a heaping size of foam head. Aroma is potent with rich coffee bean blended with a sweet chocolate or cocoa powder scent. Flavor is sweet and this Baltic porter drinks similar to a cold coffee with a lot of added sugar while still tasting like a beer. Although it was a tasty recipe, it does come across too sweet.

22 oz bottle one of the twelve beers of Christmas 2016 The Baltic Porter poured black in color with a tan head. Espresso Coffee immediately assaults your senses. There is bitter chocolate noted. Not being a coffee drinker this is over the top with coffee. The porter has a medium body with soft carbonation. The flavor has hints of hop bitterness blended with chocolate, vanilla, and more espresso coffee. Not sure this is a beer that I would seek out.

Bottle shared with sarky northner. Black good tan head. Aroma is nice ice cream candy good choc roasty dark malts. Taste same nice sweetness good smokey roast nice long bitter finish nice smooth mouthfeel. Very good

Bottle shared at the family Christmas gathering thanks to s_Hartshorne, cheers Shane. Black beer with medium tan head. Aroma of roast malts, chocolate and expresso. Taste is expresso, chocolate, roast malts and dry bitterness. Very good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: bottle @ Party Town / Florence KY --- Aroma of toasted malt. Opaque black color, deep tan head that drops to a full cover, lace cobwebs. Taste is toasted malt and coffee with cream, medium fizz, and mild hops in a long coffee finish. Hides the abv very well. A solid, balanced, complex brew. Recommended.
Deep brown, with tan head. Aroma is coffee, slight roast, slight green pepper. Sweet, medium rosast coffee. Pretty good.

Draft at the Va Beach brewery. Wow, my first visit here did not disappoint. This is some excellent shite. Big, with a Trump-like personality, bold and rich, full of chocolate, java. The espresso bean presence gives its full return on investment. (#6406, 11/19/2016)
Bottle: Super tasty and easy to drink. Lots of coffee in the flavor with a smooth finish.
From a 22 oz. bottle shared at home. Pours a hazy cola with an tan head. Aroma of coffee and cocoa. Flavors of chocolate with a hint of licorice. Bitter roast finish.

Bomber, thanks Brenn79. Expired about two and a half months ago. Aroma is chocolate milk, coffee, dark bread crust, licorice. Pours nearly black with a beige head that lasts a minute before collapsing into a big-bubbly collar. Taste starts out sweet, finishing bitter with the most prominent flavor being licorice, followed by chocolate, bread crust and coffee. The aftertaste is of lingering espresso. Pretty good.

Draft to taster at Cappys pour dark mahogany brown with moderate ecru head. Nose big coffee, roasted malt, dark chocolate, hint of red fruit. taste espresso, all coffee up front. Dark roast and dark chocolate mid palate, but keeps coming back to the coffee.

An intriguing beer, complex aroma of malt, coffee, and chocolate, pours a bark brown color with a lasting tan head. The taste is complex with notes of sweet malt, espresso, chocolate and nuts. Has a full bodied feel and a lasting bitter espresso finish.
Poured from a tap into a tasting glass at the Oceana Beer Festival. Decent head at first, chocolate brown, coffee aroma. Malty, rich, delicious.
On tap at Citizen Burger (Charlottesville, VA). Roasty coffee aromas, earthy, dark chocolate. Brown black with a mostly lasting beige head. Dry, roasty, with a pleasant bitterness. Full bodied.

22 oz bottle- Pours black with a tan head. Aroma is strong roasted espresso beans, mocha. The taste is similar, roasted espresso up front, chocolate, dark roasted malts, body is medium to almost full, a beer like this i would be okay with it being more thick and chewy. This is alcoholic coffee here, and i love it!

Wow Ive loved coffee stouts, porters and IPAs before but this is an unadulterated homage to coffee in a beer form. Theres little from the hops in terms of flavour and not a lot of chocolate or sweetness in the malt. Just coffee with some chocolate and vegetable in the malt. Not too distant from my cold brewed coffee.

22oz bottle. Small tan head atop cola dark brown body. Aroma is moderately sweet, chococoffee, some roast, light smoke. Taste is moderately sweet, coffee, some milk chocolate, roast, light smoke, alcohol warming. Medium-full body, some stickiness, light carbonation.

Bottle 0.66l at Ratebeer Belgian Summer Gathering 2016 Evergem, Belgium. 03.09.2016. Thanks Klaas for hosting and RB guys for sharing todays beers. Pour it dark color with small black head. Aroma milk chocolate, smooth mocha coffee, really nice. Taste is totally espresso coffee, creamy smooth texture, some roasted malt in the back, medium to full body, average to soft carbonation, bitter finish. Great after taste. Perfect!

Bottle. Light aromas of toasted cereal and cookie for the malt, resin for the hops, leather for the yeast, with notes of coffee, and tobacco in the background. Head is small, frothy turning creamy, tan with good lacing and is mostly lasting. Color is very dark brown. Flavor starts lightly sweet and acidic, then finishes lightly sweet, acidic and only slightly bitter. Palate is on the fuller side of medium, creamy with a soft carbonation. What a perfectly smooth and easy drinking Baltic Porter.

Poured from 22 oz. bottle. 

Opaque, near-black with a with a 2-finger light tan head and good lacing. 

Aroma of roasted coffee, roasted sweet chocolate malt and nuts. 

Taste of espresso, sweet cocoa, roasted malt and nuts. 

Lots of coffee and chocolate malt with a nice interplay of sweet dark malts and bitter roasted coffee flavors.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

3/IX/16 - 1Pt. 6Fl. Oz. bottle @ RBBSG V (Klaas place) - BB: X/8/16 (2016-951) Thanks to Benzai for sharing the bottle!
Clear dark brown beer, practically no head. Aroma: coffee, more coffee, roasted, just coffee actually. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: coffee, little sweet, mocha, malty, slightly roasted, more mocha. Aftertaste: cocoa powder, mocha, some caramel, roasted finish. Decent beer, just a bit too much coffee for me.

(Green Flash Cosmic Ristretto Black Lager) Bottle 650 ml at home, served into a snifter, ABV 8.2%
Blackk coloured body, small and thin light brown head on top, with average retention.
The aroma has lots of coffee, dark chocolate and roasted malts.
Taste is of cold coffee and coffee grrounds, dark chocolate, roasted malts, coal, nicely bitter with a bit of mocha on the finish.
Medium body with good carbonation.
Very good.
Pours a really dark brown with a foamy beige head. Aroma is full of the coffee with a slight nuttiness. Flavour of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee and finishes on a bitter note.

Draught. Inky dark brown with foamy beige head, sharp coffee aroma, medium carbonation, medium bitter coffee taste with some sweetness, thickish smooth body, long finish with medium bitterness. Very smooth and satisfying.

Shared bomber at the 7th Sep 2016 Shrewsbury Exchange Gathering. Dark brown body, Camp Coffee flavours and aromas with a bitter finish. Not too sure I could have managed the whole 22oz (US) bottle, even though I thought it both interesting and enjoyable.
Bottle @ September 16 tasting, Chez Sophie. Pours very dark brown with a thin tan head. Big nutty cofffee aroma, taste is smooth grimy cocoa, coffee, roast. Went well with maltesers.
Pretty damn good showing: The malts and espresso work well together--even has a hop bite. The finish is a little harsh in my opinion, but this is a good offering. 22oz bottle
(Tap) clear, bright, dark amber colour with a small brown head; aroma of smoked nuts, hint of jam; intense, balanced flavour with a long, light bitter finish; smooth palate

F: not big, brownish.
C: dark red to dark, clear.
A: coffee, roasted malt, coffee ground, hint of fruits, chocolate, vanilla
T: roasted malt, coffee tones mainly, hint of fruits, chocolate, liquorice, full body, lower carbonation, very good, 65cl bottle shared at RBBSG V (2016), many thanks.

Draft at Logans Alley - pours black with dark tan head . Huge espresso and rich chocolate aroma . Sweet cocoa and rich espresso flavors . Awesome ! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sampled from 0.65 l bottle at RBBSG 2016 in Evergem. Clear, dark red to very dark brown with a beige head. Sweetish, roasty-malty aroma of coffee, dark chocolate and some nuts. Sweetish-malty, moderately roasty and a little smoky taste of caramel, dark chocolate, coffee and some smoke, followed by a medium long, quite roasty-bitter, a little warming finish. Medium body, slightly creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Nice!

Thxi to Benzai. 650 ml. bottle sampled @ RBBSG V. Dark brown, little tanned head. Nose is delicious coffee, there is sweet coffee & chocolate base, also roasted coffee & espresso, mellow, complimentary, not too bitter. Taste is same, great mocha base, chocolate, sweet, sugar, faintest molasses with not overly bitter (for me), complimentary espresso & roasted coffee notes, Easy bodied, very drinkable, very nice.
Bottle shared with the work crew. Pours dark brown with a thin beige head. Aromas of strong dark coffee, light chocolate. Taste is crisp and clean, more coffee, light sweet finish.
UPDATED: OCT 8, 2016 At rbbsg16. Thnx for sharing People ! Pours dark, ni real head. Smell is coffee, roasty. Taste is coffee, roasty, dark malts. Ok, but too Sharp coffee.
66cl bottle @RBBSG2016. Fast schwarze Farbe, geringe beige schaumkrone. Geruch nach Kaffeebohnen, trocken, schokoladig. Geschmack süß schokoladig, Kaffee, Vanille, milchig.

Pours dark mahogany tinged black into an English pint. Mocha head with excellent retention recedes leaving scant sheets. Espresso and dark chocolate aromas. Creamy milk chocolate upfront turning to dark espresso before the lasting milky pit fruit finish. Nice.

Custom Green Flash bomber pours with a mahogany colored body that supports a nice light mocha head. The aroma offers up loads of chocolate followed by a bit of molasses covered raisins and lightly roasted coffee. The taste delivers chocolate, roasty coffee and sweet malts laced with a bit of molasses. To midway a mild sweet raisin and prune fruity ester sensation comes to the surface and leading into persistent coffee into the finish. As it warms a little I get hints of earthy coffee notes creating a pretty nice Baltic Porter experience.

Draft at the Mansion. Pours dark nut brown with a creamy tan head. Tastes like dark chocolate malt, cinnamon, booze, and ashy wood. Medium body and low/medium carbonation. Smells like dark chocolate malt, booze, cinnamon, and ashy wood.
Bomber. Black, low head. Nose is cocoa, coffee, light soy. Big flavor, roasty, sweet cocoa and coffee, bitter roast finish. Rather full body.

Aroma is nutty and roasted grains. Flavor is milky, bitter and somewhat coffee. Pours almost black with a thick tan head. Had at home out of a bottle 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

bottle. Brown with one finger head. Big and boozy. Strong malt body. Coffee, dark chocolate, dark fruit, light sweetness. Reasonably complex, but I struggled to make it all the way through the bomber. First glass was definitely better than the second.
On tap at The Urban Tap at RBSG. . Pours black with beige head. Nose of coffee and chocolate, Medium body and a creamy mouth feel. Flavor if full of the coffee and there is a bitter chocolate finish.

On tap at Bier:Thirty dark brown black modest tan head and thick lacing that dries on the sides. Big dark roast and coffee aromas and flavors. Quite bitter and bold. Big lingering espresso roast bitter trailer. I feel like this would improve with several months in the bottle

Bottle with a Best Before Date: 25 August, 16. Deep brown (almost black color) thin beige head without lace. Nose is rich hazelnut coffee and roasted malts. Glad I got to this now because it seems like the espresso bean is on the verge of turning the other direction. 
Borderline astringent coffee bean. That said, it has a stern roasted backbone with a medium plus body. Texture is pretty smooth and creamy and pleasing. No alcohol notable anyplace in the flavor. Overall, I am glad I got to this now but I have a strong feeling had I sampled this 3 months ago, my rating would be much higher.

22 oz bomber poured into a pint glass. Black pour, khaki colored head with nice lacing. Aroma is of coffee and semi sweet chocolate, hints of liquorice and dark fruit. Very smooth and rich, hides the 8.2% ABV well, really liked the aftertaste. Would recommend it to friends!

Bottle, Brewdog Leicester. Near black with a beige head. Earthy roast coffee with dark chocolate bitterness. Creamy with burnt toffee. Hints of soy sauce meatiness. Vanilla oak barrel with brown sugar. Oily body with a herbal liquorice finish. Very good.

Refrigerated 0.5 L brown bottle poured into a snifter. Dark brow with big medium brown highlights and very small off-white head. Aroma is coffee, medium body, lower carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is big coffee and dark malt.

Bottle at home. Dark brown with a tall tan head with decent retention. Notes of roasted malts, espresso, roasted coffee beans, chocolate, caramel, bitter hops, licorice and cherries. Bitter-sweet, medium bodied, medium to low carbonation and a chocolate-coffee roasted finish.

Tallahassee, Fl - Beer Stop - 22 oz bomber. Pitch black pour, initial rocky, khaki colored head that fades after a while. Aroma has some hints of creosote, a touch of licorice, heavy hints of espresso. Flavor runs along the same lines, loads of espresso goodness, some bittersweet unsweetened chocolate, a touch of biscott cookie notes. Thick, sticky mouthfeel. Very enjoyable.

Bottle at home. Aroma is roasted malt, lots of espresso, coffee, mocha, caramel, creamy chocolate. Flavour is medium sweet with a moderate roasty bitterness in the finish. Body is above medium and a bit creamy. Excellent Porter with a big roasty coffee aroma.
Bottle into a pint glass. Pours black, with a small tan head that quickly fades. Nose is coffee and malt. Taste follows. Nicely balanced, with good flavor. Good stuff.
Totally black and oily. Really nice oily and acidic espresso aroma. Really good coffee flavor throughout. Slightly sweet with a Ro chocolate. Thin body but really coats the tongue. Unique.

22 ounce bottle into snifter, best before 8/25/2016. Pours nearly opaque dark brown/black color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense and fluffy tan head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of big nutty dark roasted coffee, dark chocolate, cocoa, caramel, brown sugar, and toasted dark bread; with lighter notes of raisin, plum, currant, vanilla, smoke, char, herbal, wood, and roast/toasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of dark/roast/bready malt, coffee, and light-moderate fruity yeast/earthy hop notes; with great strength. Taste of big nutty dark roasted coffee, dark chocolate, cocoa, caramel, brown sugar, and toasted dark bread; with lighter notes of raisin, plum, currant, vanilla, smoke, char, herbal, wood, and roast/toasted earthiness. Moderate roast and herbal hop bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of coffee, dark chocolate, cocoa, caramel, brown sugar, toasted dark bread, herbal, wood, and roast/toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt, coffee, and light-moderate fruity yeast/earthy hop flavors; with a great roast/hop bitter/sweet balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light dryness from hop/roast bitterness as well. Medium carbonation and medium-full body; with a very smooth, creamy, and fairly sticky/chalky balanced mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an outstanding Baltic porter! All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt, coffee, and light-moderate fruity yeast/earthy hop flavors; very smooth and easy to drink for the ABV. A highly enjoyable offering.
Draft - pours black tan head - nose/taste of coffee, light roast and light pine - medium body

On tap at brewpub. An orange hued black lager with a resilient beige head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, hazelnut, red berry. Flavor is coffee, chocolate, some hazelnut. Finish is strong dark chocolate and coffee bitterness. Lingering dark berry flavors. Medium to full body, weak to average carbonation.

2015 BJCP Category: 30A Spice/Herb/Vegetable (base brew: 9C Baltic Porter)
AROMA: Espresso; some dark fruit; slight musty odor. 8/12APPEARANCE: Deep blood red to black proper. Large, tan foam with good persistence. 3/3FLAVOR: Dark debittered malt throughout. Some dark fruity flavors linger in the background. Roasted malt/slightly burnt toast at the apex. Espresso and dark chocolate emerge on the finish with moderate bitterness. Slight tang. 14/20MOUTHFEEL: Medium/full bodied; soft and smooth. Little alcohol warmth or flavor. Coffee taste lingers. Slightly watery texture. 3/5OVERALL IMPRESSION: An interesting take on Baltic Porter, but probably wouldve worked better as a traditional stout. 7/10TOTAL SCORE: 35/50DISCLAIMER: The author is not a certified BJCP judge; therefore, this score sheet is not necessarily indicative of proper BJCP judging techniques and protocol. The author is grading to 2015 BJCP Guidelines in order to prepare for examination.
Bottle. Blackish beer with a tan head. Coffee and roast aroma. Caramel and coffee flavor. Medium bodied. Caramel and coffee linger with light mineral notes.
Bottle. Pours black. Aroma and taste are lots of bitter coffee, chocolate, roasted malts, medium bodied.
Sampled at Urban Tap. Black with a small beige ring. Big full coffee aroma is rich. The flavor falls off some. Earthy and roasty. Bigger coffee. Almost really good. A rich smooth feel.
Draft - Nice dark espresso. Jet black with a small beige head. Dark espresso and a big bitterness. Just like cold pressed espresso.
On tap at The Urban Tap. Pours black with beige head that lasts. The aroma is coffee and milk chocolate. Medium body, roast, cocoa, light bitterness, good.

Bottle courtesy of Green Flash. Pours a brown ale brown with an off-white head. Nose is roast, espresso, earth, lager, cola, and nice cocoa. Flavor hits with cola, roast, earth, lager, cocoa, and a nice round Baltic Porter. Medium to full in body and lingering earthy cocoa and lager in the finish.

8.2%ABV. Baltic Porter.

Poured out dark brown black. 38ºSRM.

Nose has coffee, charcoal, dark stone fruit, black cherries, honeyed dates.

Mouthfeel is light soap. Palate has black bread, cookie dough, honeyed graham cracker, dates, raw honey. There are flavors of charcoal, burnt barley toast, and a very faint lightly dry ume finish. Burn at the back of the throat. Light phenol right at the very very end, faintly. I do so like the light date tea like flavor, sweet and fruity on the front of the palate. There are also roasted azuki flavors on the palate.

Finish is carbon bitter with the character of good charcoal. Overall, like an aggressive espresso roast. In this Im not sure the ristretto comparison works because the clean bitter, roasted flavors predominate rather than floral or fruity which ristrettos tend to boast.

Goes on Favorites List !
Pours a dark, cola black, with minimal head. Aroma has some chocolate, some coffee, a touch of cinnamon. Flavor has chocolate, coffee, some creamy chocolate milk. Pretty good.
Great beer. Long taste of chocolate, vanilla, cigarettes, caramel. Light palate, easy to drink.

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2016 Draft at The Irish Pol. Black pour with lacy white curtains. Semi-glossy black cocoa with dark roasted espresso. Hints of black liquorice charcoal burnt marshmallow, maybe Bing Cherry. Not overly complex but not bad at all.

Poured a darker brown with a beige head. Aroma was of of light coffee and chocolate. Flavor was big chocolate notes, lots of cocoa, espresso is a bit in the background. Incredibly drinkable for the abv. Noce.

650 ml bottle. Pours dark brown with light whitish head, Aromas of nuts and dried chocolate malts. Flavors of sweet nutty chocolate, roasted coffee, amarillo, and smooth roasted malts. Perfect balance. Tasty.

On tap at Belmont Station, pours black with a reddish tinge and a medium tan head. Aroma brings out rich espresso notes upfront, with a little cocoa and a touch of roast. Flavour is rich and complex, with lovely espresso notes, with a touch of dark fruit and cocoa. Really fantastic addition of the coffee. Excellent.

How come this is called Black Lager? Anyhoo, it pours a barely translucent chocolate brown with a fairly thick light tan head. Aroma delivers quality coffee, chocolate, roasted malt, charred hops and molasses tones. Im going totally Pavlov! Flavor nicely echoes the aroma but with more smoke and charcoal. Sweetness is subtle and pleasing. Mouthfeel delivers fairly firm body and good fizz. Dont ristretto yourself, go cosmic!

Bottle @ Van Moll Brewpub shared with Nick who happened to sit next to me at the bar. Cheers! Almost opaque dark brown color, medium sized light brown colored head. Aroma is malts, heavy espresso, firm roast, caramel. Taste malts, roasted malts, again heavy espresso, roast espresso bitter with a slight underlying sweetish caramel and chocolaty hint. Decent body, subtle carbonation. Lovely beer!

Pours dark brown with a small beige head. Smells strongly of chocolate and coffee. Taste is earthy, coffee, and bitter. Medium-bodied with a smooth texture and soft mouth-carbonation, Green Flash Cosmic Ristretto finishes with a smooth coffeeness.
Black, thin brown head. Smells like coffee and raisins. Taste is a nice mix of espresso and pit fruit, with just a touch of smokiness. Some red wine and oak, too. Tasty stuff.

Une bière brune et sa tête mousseuse bien montée et tenace. Au nez, explosion de café avec des nuances de poivre et de cannelle et de chocolat doux et de caramel. En bouche, base maltée davantage en appui avec des touches fruitées dans un liquide pour amateur de café de qualité. Un corps moyen et un bon pétillement. Une texture huileuse. Une finale qui tente un équilibre. Porter baltique qui cache son origine sous ce café qui rend par moment la chose légèrement difficile à boire.

[ bottle ][ 1.5oz ][ @Tasting ][ $? ][ schnapps snifter ][ 03.05.15 ]
red-hued sepia, thick cream head, light lacing. Heavy roast nose, light chocolate sweetness. Simple with light/off olive note a la some HotD. Heavy coffee flavor dominates with light chocolate but very straightforward, simple, lacks malt and hop balance.

A 22 fl oz bottle with a best by date of 10th August 2016 and poured into a snifter glass. It poured a clear dark brown colour with a reddish hue and a one finger beige head that dissipated fairly quickly to a thin ring of lacing. Aromas full of dark fruits especially grape, bubblegum and roasty espresso with a hint of chocolate and vanilla. Tastes of lots of coffee and espresso with a light char. Hint of dark fruit sweetness, mostly grape, plum and prunes as well as a hint of bittersweet chocolate and vanilla. Medium to full bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall a solid Baltic Porter with nice coffee and espresso notes.

Bottle:
Rubied-cola colour....with a thick tan head.
Strong espresso, cocoa aroma.
Taste is chocolate roast, espresso, vanilla......
Very creamy and rich....
Decadently nice stuff.
Bottle. Earthy lactic coffee, chocolate malt, and straw aroma. Dark brown with small tan head. Moderately sweet creamy coffee, chocolate malt, and mildly bitter hay flavor. Nice body. Very good.
Bomber. This was awesome. Lots of espresso and soft roasty notes buried in between a silky smooth baltic porter...lots of cocoa and cold brew coffee as well. Dank!

Ristretto, too Michael ristretto! Aroma of coffee (ristretto), chocolate and cherries. Clear, dark brown colour with a small head. Flavours are ristrotto without lots of sugar. Bitter sourish and dry aftertaste. Not my thing.

Pitch black, white head. Nice carbonation.
Smell is coffee, some ash. Subtle sweetness.
Taste is bitter sweet. Lots of coffee mixed with caramel. Hint of cinammon. Astringent finish. Over the top. Too sweet with unpleasent bitterness.
On tap at Giant Eagle, UA: black pour, amber tint, tan head. aroma of big roasted coffee. tastes same, herbal, cocoa, toffee. slick thin to medium palate. little chalky in bitter finish. nice.

Sample at Winking Lizard Westerville during the "Get Green with Green Flash Night" event on 05/17/2016. Dark brown pour with ruddy edges, and a medium foamy tan head that recedes steadily to a film. Small patches of lacing on the glass. Aroma of roasted coffee, malt and chocolate. Medium body with flavors of roasty coffee and malt, along with some vanilla. The finish is sweetened espresso and malt. Pretty good overall.

Cosmic Ristretto enjoys a kick from a big dose of cold-pressed espresso. It gives this beer a lot of coffee depth: earth, chocolate, roast, nut. Theres also some dark bread character from the malt. Baltic Porter has a lot of potential for coffee infusion and Green Flash has done an exceptionally good job of blending the bold, bitter qualities of espresso with this style.This brew is rich and full-bodied. Theres brightness from the fresh coffee and bittersweetness throughout. 8.2% might be a bit much for a breakfast beer, but Id sure be willing to try.

Bottle.

A- Black coffee, floral bitterness.

A- Black color, dark liquid, tan head.

T- Black coffee, floral, roasty, dry, cocoa.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, balanced finish.

O- Definitely an earthy, floral, and bitter coffee forward beer. Not near the sweetness or espresso/cocoa flavor I expected. Didnt love it didnt hate it.

Bottle.

Head is initially average sized, frothy, light brown, mostly diminishing.
Body is dark brown to black.

Aroma is moderately malty (coffee, roasted grain/nuts, dark chocolate), with notes of vanilla and stones/minerals.

Flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, moderately to heavily bitter.

Medium to full body, watery/syrupy texture, lively carbonation, lightly to moderately alcoholic. 

Starts out pretty nice with delightful coffee expression and roasty/chocolatey malts in the nose, certainly enticing if too coffee-centric and limited in complexity. In the mouth its harder to enjoy, where the flavor balance is rather harsh (lots of sugar, lots of finishing bitterness, but thankfully fairly low acidity) and the mouthfeel rather thick and syrupy. But...doesnt "ristretto" mean confined/limited/narrow in Italian? Ironically that may be true to some extent, given how dependent this beer is on the added coffee, but it doesnt seem like what they were intending to convey.

APARIENCIA: de color marrón intenso, casi negro, se observan algunos destellos marrones claros a contraluz y ligera actividad de carbonatación; corona de espuma color beige, de mediana a baja retención, de burbuja compacta y algunas abiertas.

AROMA: los granos de espresso es lo que predomina de forma intensa, el azúcar no procesado, algunos frutos oscuros, licoroso como jerez y ligeramente chocolate semiamargo.

SABOR: los granos de espresso es lo que predomina, atrás notas de grano tostado, chocolate semiamargo, azúcar no procesado, frutos oscuros como ciruelas, dátiles e hígos y una ligera nota ácida que realmente es muy efímera y es nada astringente; en el retrogusto queda un amargor medio ligero con buena permanencia de las notas a café tostado y ligeramente dulce.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo medio ligero con ligera sensación untuosa en boca, carbonatación media a baja.

RESUMEN: excelente cerveza de acuerdo al estilo, con un manejo impecable de los adjuntos.

Draft at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014 - Red Session. Pours clear, dark brown with a beige foam head. The nose holds rich coffee, dark bread and light cocoa. Medium sweet flavour with nicely balanced coffee character, milk chocolate, mild bitterness. Light to medium bodied with average carbonation. Creamy coffee in the finish, with some rich bready malts, gooey chocolate. Superbly well balanced overall, with nice depth, too. Exceptional.

22 ounce bottle - $8.99 at Total Wine & More in Kennesaw, Georgia.

Best By 25 AUG 16.

Appearance: Pours a very dark brown, near black body with nearly an inch of light beige foam.

Smell: Charred, roasty, oil-sheened espresso beans on the nose backed by cacao and dense dark bread for a brisk mocha aroma.

Taste: A start of sweet-toned roastiness from both the malts as well as the espresso, a little dark chocolate but also a little bit of astringency, settling into hints of vanilla-infused cream and dark fruit. Roastiness settles a bit, leaving a bittersweet finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-plus body. Medium carbonation. A slight creaminess felt on the tongue.

Overall: Pretty solid for the most part, it grew on me as it went.
A brown beer with a tan head. The aroma has notes of coffee, chocolate, and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of chocolate, vanilla, and coffee, leading to a dry roasted finish.
Great aromas and flavors of roasted malt, coffee and just enough bitterness. Dark color with a frothy head. Full bodied and weighty.

Delicious coffee forward porter. Theres a ton of chocolate fudge, caramel and coffee in the aroma. Tons of coffee to be exact. Taste is absolutely a blast of really high quality coffee, which is awesome. Its not a generic coffee taste. Theres chocolate, and caramel as well. The coffee is the highlight though, its really front and center and takes it to the next level. Overall, for the price and taste this beer is a huge win. $6.99 for a bomber of delicious coffee porter, hell yeah.

Smells of roasted malts and strong dark roasted coffee. Super silky black color. Taste of dark roasted malts and dark sweet coffee coming through then to a bitter finish. Full body with lite carbonation. Love the coffee flavor in the profile on this brew. Nice work

Bottle, almost opaque ruddy brown beer, decent almond colored head, some lace. Aroma coffee, dark malts, cookies. Taste is sweet chocolate, cola, coffee, vanilla, cookies. Palate very smooth and thick, carbonation almost nitro like. On the finish comes some hops to dry out all that sugar, and yes, its a bit sweet at first, and somehow makes that transition without being too harsh.
Bottle. Deep, dark brown with a dark tan head. Aroma was a sweet, espresso smell. Taste was a nice creamy coffee.
Draught at Hop Cat. Dar chocolate coffee goodness. Rich and big with medium mouthfeel.

At first smell I thought this beer would be a 4+ rating but the taste was a bit to bitter for me. It still has a great coffee flavor and at 8.2 it packs a little punch. Overall I would recommend it but proceed with caution

On tap at The Mayor of Old Town. Black appearance with a tan head. Pleasant nose of fresh coffee and roasted malt aromatics. Similar flavor, adding rich, chocolate malt notes with light caramel and light vanilla. Dark, malty and smooth with a creamy feel and a bittersweet finish over a medium to full body. Nicely done.
Has a hard time chugging this bomber in one breath, but I managed. It had a lot of carb.

650 ml. bb 15 July 2016. Nose of charred grain and espresso, with hints of cocoa and soy. Pours clear, deep mahogany with a touch of ruby red. Creamy quarter-inch wafer of foam on top. Tastes of espresso with sourish cream, lightly tart berry, charred grain, cocoa nibs and dark caramel. A bit of Oreo cookie and iron at times as well. Medium-heavy body has smooth, medium fizz and a nice balance. Good but the dark grain is too close to scorched at times.

Aroma: chocolate, roasty, heavy coffee
Appearance: dark brown with a tan head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, coffee
Palate: medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Delicious
Bottle from Whole Foods in Redwood City, CA. Good coffee flavor (a tad burnt) with some cocoa and chocolate malts. A better coffee beer but still mildly gimmicky / kids cereal.

Thanks Andy.
This was poured into an English pint glass.
The appearance was a dark brown close to black color with a thin white to off white foamy thin head. Semi-thin foamy lacing glosses around the sides of the glass nicely.
The smell had a rich dark espresso to milky chocolate/semi-sweet cocoa bean but also somewhat burnt coffee bean. Decent roast.
The taste tried to follow through on the wanted flavor. Mainly had that roasty to burnt flavor rolling on into the aftertaste. Slight dry/roasty/burnt finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a medium on the body with the burnt/roasty/espresso sort of feel hitting my tongue decently. Hmmm...theres a part of me that wants to say "excessively," hmmm...not bad.
Overall, for a Baltic Porter, pretty good for the most part, leans a bit more towards the roasty sort of almost burnt coffee bean-esque thing. I think I could have again, yeah, pretty sure I could.
Amazing coffee, amazing chocolate but still lets you know its a beer. Finish has a nice touch of licorice.

Heavy deep brown pour with a thin light tan head that recedes pretty quickly. Amazing nose of Mexican sweet dark chocolate with a bolstering aroma of cake and strong black coffee. Big palate full of roast malt, coffee cake, earthy sweet chocolate, and a mild earthy cocoa/coffee bitterness on a nice roasty sweet finish. Amazing. Loads of coffee but also loads of slightly cinnamon-esque chocolate.

Bottle from ABV. Pours a dark ruddy brown color with a small beige head. A big sweet caramel and coffee nose- straight out of Starbucks. The flavor is similar; big sweet coffee, vanilla, some very heavy rich coffee. Works very well.

On tap at Flying Saucer, Memphis. Dark, roasty, coffee. Somewhere between a schwarzbier and a Baltic porter though my preference would be for it to lean more heavily toward the Baltic porter than it does. Not bad.

Draft at Smiling Chameleon. Pours black with a thin khaki head. Doesn't leave much lacing in the glass. Big coffee notes on the nose. Coffee on the tongue mixes nicely with a kind of licorice note. Finished clean. Hides it's booze well. Solid to nice example of style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours black with a very fluffy tan head that hands around awhile. Aroma is rich roasted malts, ash and coffee. Taste also brings the roasted malty goodness with notes of bitter expresso coffee and a touch of sweet toffee. Very smooth and rich. A beautiful beer. Excellent!

22oz bottle from beer junction. Really love the dark espresso color on this and once sipped the espresso really comes out. Tiny bit of chocolate malts. The tastes are rather complex however really fade quickly. Really great beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle and Draft, bottle was muted compared to the brilliance of draft, scores combined .. . black brown .. really great foam presence .. . coffee, beans, black sharpie, and espresso burps .. mouth is soft and full, very nice all around .. good stuff, but go for draft over bottle if applicable .. . . manchester is red.
Aroma is coffee/espresso, dark chocolate and earthy. The flavor is espresso/coffee/definitely cold coffee, dark malts, chocolate/dark chocolate and an earthy/surprisingly bitter finish.

Type: 12-oz. draft
Glass: Clear tulip glass 
From: Alpine Beer Company Tasting Room in Alpine, Calif.
Price: $4.75
Purchased: March 6, 2016
Consumed: March 6, 2016
Misc.: N.A

Need something to end on a high note after that disaster of Dark Elixir. Figured a coffee beer would be best option.

Poured a dark mahogany color with 1-to- fingers of khaki tan head. Excellent foamy layered lacing on the sides of the glass. Average retention on the top all the way down. (Sight - 4.25)

Smelled espresso, coffee malts, toffee caramel, vanilla, hazelnut and roasted nuts. (Smell - 4.25)

Tasted deep, dark, coffee black malts, espresso, vanilla, roasted toffee caramel and hazelnut. Follows nose perfectly. (Taste - 4.25)

Full body. Creamy texture. Average carbonation. Long, bitter finish. (Feel - 4.25)

Just a lovely coffee beer. (Overall - 4.25)

4.25 95 A

On tap at Engine 15 (JAX). 
Very dark reddish-brown body that is topped by a decent head.

Nice aroma that says "coffee!" but has notes of dark bread and hints of dark chocolate. 

Flavor: sweet up front and nicely balanced (bitter-sweet) overall. Faint dark fruits, chocolate and fine, black coffee. 

The body is smooth, medium-full,and well carbonated.

on top at blackbird. Pours a deep black to brown with a thin Panhead. Smells of coffee and a little bit of burnt rice. Medium bodied, a bit of roast, a bit of chocolate. Sweet caramel, molasses, chocolate, warm sweet and full of cocoa. Slow roasting the finish.

Pours a near black color with a khaki head. Espresso, caramel, toffee, toast, roasty malt and chocolate aroma. Espresso, cocoa, caramel, toffee, toast, nut and roasty malt flavor. Medium body and carbonation. Espresso and toast finish. Smooth. Slightly sweet.

500ml? Bottle at the March DC Tasting. Poured a dark brown color with a small tan head. Aroma was light roasted malts, some very light coffee, Creamy malt character, light espresso, but nothing overpowering. Not too bad.

Bottle, 650ml. Deep dark brown with a frothy brown head. Intense coffee and roasted aromas with fruity and spicy undertones. Robust bodied with moderate carbonation. Smooth, rich and creamy, with a deep bitter coffee character and finish. Very pleasant

Bottle, 650ml. A dark ruby beer with a small brown frothy head. Aroma is of espresso, roasted malt, nuts and alcohol. Taste is bitter with a a strong coffee character. Robust bodied with some carbonation and astringency. Really liked the espresso aftertaste.
I like my Baltic porters roasty and smooth and this beer delivers. Coffee and mild chocolate finish.
Lots of coffee and some roast. Cant get a good sense. Of lagering. Black pour with great head and lacing. Bitter finish. Some caramel. Easy drinking. Bottle.

bottle picked up from possibly the best beer store in Little Rock, and conveniently, the closest to my hotel for the evening. Poured in the all too familiar paper hotel cup, only thing I can see is the frothy light tan head that fades just enough to give a small window to see the dark pour. Super strong roasted coffee nose. Taste follows this theme, slight astringency. Medium body.

On tap at bitter creek boise. Pours out black topped with a tan head. nose is big coffee sweet chocolate roast malts and some vanilla. taste is more of the heavy coffee roast malts sweet milk chocolate.
Nice coffee smell. Bitter coffee taste. Medium body, medium carbonation, and a bit of foam.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Deep mahogany color with tan foam. Very nice espresso dark coffee, semisweet chocolate, dark malt aromas. Smooth medium body. Super tasty nutty, fruity, dark roast espresso flavors with sweet dark chocolate, pale maltage----smooth coffee finish____very good coffee brew.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: This doesnt have the bright, crisp finish that I associate with Baltic porters. But, at more than 8% ABV, and with chocolate and espresso, I probably shouldnt expect it to be remotely light. This beer pours dark brown with average head. The aroma is chocolate and the same sugary malt aroma that I associate with Baltics. The flavor is rich and sweet, like a chocolate stout up front. The malt and yeasty bread notes come through very mildly on the finish, along with some vapor. Not what I want in a Baltic porter, but tasty enough on its own terms that I can forgive that.
Bottle. Pours a dark brown with a ring of beige head. Aroma and taste is intense espresso, roasted malts, chocolate.

Charred meat and coffee nose, very beefy. Cloudy mahogany, thick tan head, good lacing. Espresso, roasted malt, much less meaty. Full body, easy carbonation. This is a big boy baltic porter, to lagers what stouts are to ales.
Dark brown to black pour. Oily, tan head. Super burnt espresso bean aroma. Chocolate and roasted beans. Interesting.

Opaque black liquid with a medium tan head. Aroma of coffe, light ash, chocolate, bread and pumpernickel. Taste is dry and light to medium bitter with notes of coffee and chocolate. Medium bodied with medium carbonation.
Draft. Deep dark brown color, subtle maroon notes, tan head. Aroma of peppery cocoa. Taste has roast, dark fruit, lightly bitter finish. Tasty.

Pours a finger of tan head on a black body.
The aroma is roasted malt, burnt wood, coffee and milk.
The taste is coffee bitter, milk and chocolate. Nice blend.
The texture is super smooth and creamy.
Wow.
Draft. Pours near black with a beige head. Sweet mocha, cold brew coffee, and cream. Moderate sweetness throughout with just a ton of rich coffee. Good stuff and quite drinkable.

The beer pours dark brown with a large tan head. The aroma has used coffee grounds, dirty earth, roasted malt and a bit of spice. The smell is pretty intense. It has a medium/full body with a modest amount of carbonation. The taste starts with dark chocolate, espresso, hefty roast, dark caramel and a hint of vanilla. The finish has lots of coffee and some spicy hops. Pretty solid.

22 oz from Sams for 8.79. Im not sure if this beer has been re-branded but the bottle specifically states its a Baltic porter, not a schwarzbier. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma is very weird; slight coffee with a big candy-like aroma. Bottle does specifically mention "Belgian candy sugar" on the side. Taste is a weird burnt coffee flavor up front leading to the Belgian-style flavor on the back end. Body is average, not standing out in any way. Honestly Im not a big fan. The coffee flavor doesnt appeal to me at all and the Belgian flavors are too sweet. I love a good stout/porter with some Belgian flavors but it just doesnt work here.

Aromas of dark malts, espresso, subtle smoke, chalky dark malts, cocoa and toffee. Pours dark black with thick lacing against the glass. Taste is thick roasted malts, chocolate, smoked malt, slight ash characteristic, roasted coffee, espresso oils and a slight nuttiness. Finish leaves a distinct chocolate, candied caramel sweetness and smoke. Overall, a unique brew with aggressive roast and espresso notes.

Rating #1567 - 20.03.2015 - Birthday Brew Tour Stop #3 - On tap at Green Flash. Little bit of tan bubbly foam on an opaque black pour. Lots of espresso, cocoa notes, mild earth. Palate maintains a light body, but cocoa espresso sweet and bitter notes keep you coming back to this excellent Schwarz.
On tap @ the brewery in Miramar. Dark brown, russet tones. Coffee and cocoa, dry finish. Decent.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Listed as a baltic porter with espresso at Green Flash Mira Mesa. Pours a deep black with tan head that leaves good lace. Aroma and taste of big coffee and roast notes, a hint of fruity yeast. Clean and easy, alcohol well hidden, really nice non-hoppy beer from them.

4 oz pour on draft at Rustico Ballston. Dark brownish black with light tan head. Aromas of espresso, caramel, chocolate. Tastes of coffee, burnt espresso, caramel, dark chocolate, roasty notes. Medium body with a dry finish. Lots of nice coffee/espresso flavor.
Taster. Dark black with foamy white head and lacing (on nitro ). Smoke and coffee on the nose and palate... Very nice...

[ Keg ][ 4oz ][ Cellar 3 ][ $2 ][ Tasting Flute ][ 6.20.15 ]
>> Wow- really have been dodging this beer and boy was that a mistake. Clear deep red pour, good beige foam. Nose is rich hazelnut coffee, Baileys. Taste is rich hazelnut praline, silky and assertive, bitter and firmly balanced. Expressive coffee that never devolves to green bell pepper. No alcohol. Really quite crushable. Should be more popular.
Draught. This is a delicious and seductive Schwartbier. Best to drink it early in the day though or be prepared to be up all night.
Coffee, black malt, and bitter chocolate accentuates both flavor and aroma. Lager yeast is bright when beer is cold but wheres off as it warms.

For the un-caffeinated, ristretto is a short shot of espresso with roughly half the amount of water, but the same coffee content as a standard shot. It is to espresso as espresso is to coffee: bolder, fuller, more intense. A pour for coffee purists. The beers colored deep black, topped with a thick layer of froth the density and color of latte foam. Oily coffee beans, molasses, dark chocolate and burnt toast swirl in the nose. The coffee note is knife-sharp, with a hint of tangy fruitiness. Chocolate malts contribute a more cocoa-focused flavor, with nutty, peppery coffee still present, albeit in lesser amounts. Fuzzy carbonation excites the medium-light body, while the alcohol delivers soft, peppery heat and a bit of numbness. A must-try for coffee-lovers.
Smells like coffee, tastes like coffee but a little bit maltier and cereal, nice light hoppiness to balance, creamy kind of finish

Tap at The Big Legrowlski in Portland. Snifter glass. Deep amber, almost black in color. Limited off white head. Aroma of coffee and caramel. Taste leans into a sweeter, Belgian effort but has the espresso undertones of a schwarzbier. Little bit of nuttiness and roasted malts. Alcohol presence. Surprised to see this type of beer from this brewery. Solid and enjoyable.

Draft at Beer Run.

I didnt take notes as I was drinking this, so I am doing it from memory. But I enjoyed the heck out of it. It was nice, smooth drinkable coffee-flavored brew.

On tap at the brewery. It pours dark brown with a light tan head. The aroma has some nice coffee with sweet cream. The flavor is sweet and chocolaty with some coffee creamer. Full creamy body. Good, but not exactly what I would call a Schwarzbier.
Tap, black pour, white head, nose is coffee, taste is nutty, caramel, sweet, light
Draft at the Birch. Dark brown color with a tan ring. Huge coffee and chocolate aroma with a hint of amaretto. The flavor has some booziness to it with espresso. Okay, a little brash.

Tap at Capitol Beer in Sacramento, CA. Pours black with a tan head. Aroms is burnt malt/hint of chocolate (note: I didnt get coffee until a bit later). Med + body. Flavor is chocolate ans smooth burnt malt. (note: I didnt get coffee until a bit later) Not dry, but not very sweet. Seems to have balancing hop. Nice schwarzbier. Suddenly after a slight break, theres a lot of coffee. Surprise. Dont know how I missed it at first.

On tap at Capitol Beer & Tap Room. Pours Dark brown with a rich tan head and a strong coffee aroma. There is a roasted coffee and chocolate flavor with a slightly bitter finish. Tastes more like an espresso than a beer. Delicious.
yeah..this was nice. after all the coffee beers Ive been enjoying lately this was still a treat.

On tap at Belmont Station. Colour...looks like....well...a cup of coffee, just not in a cup! Nose...smells like....well...a cup of coffee ( really good coffee). Palate...well...its like a cup of coffee! But...theres a sweet ( not too sweet) bit and a defined frothiness to the palate. Theres a bit of a bite that I assume is from hops but maybe the coffee has done influence there. Theres quite a roasty thing here but its not just the coffee! In fact theres a nutty/ chocolatey thing going on. The finish is lengthy and teeming with java.

Brewvival 2015 Trip #119. Keg at Brewvival. Pours a clear dark red with a thin creamy tan head. Good head retention. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, smoke. The taste is chocolate, smoke, roasted malt, dark fruits. Medium bodied.

(En cask au Blind Lady Alehouse): Un nectar qui transpire la richesse sans même sêtre approché de mes lèvres. Mocha, espresso, mélasse, chocolat au lait et petits fruits dans un corps parfait, rien de moins, fait sur mesure pour le traitement cask.

Tap at brewery. Pours opaque black with tan head. Aroma is chocolate and lightly roasted malts, rich espresso, some earthiness, and faint ash. Flavor is chocolate, espresso, some earthy bitterness, and a smooth dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

With Audrie at Brass Tap in Cordl Springs, pours a dark pitch black pour with a small head. Nose is a bit flat with mild malt and chocolate. Taste is rich, smooth and velvety with sweet chocolate , subtle smoke and coffee. Very drinkable ! Finish is sweet, somewhat dry and ends nicely. Very descent . Quaff Score 7 / 10

Tap at the brewery. Pours opaque black with a medium, creamy tan head, medium retention with light lacing. Aroma is toast and chocolate malt, roast notes, earthy hops, and prunes. Flavor is dark malt dominant, chocolate, light earthy hops and bitterness, dark fruits and a sweet finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Draught at CBC 2014. Opaque black liquid with a medium tan head. Aroma of coffe, light ash, chocolate, bread and pumpernickel. Taste is dry and light to medium bitter with notes of coffee and chocolate. Medium bodied with medium carbonation.
Tap at CBC 2014. Beer in the glass deep black, small head. Roasty malty aroma. Starts heavy malty, extremely roasty, earthy, notes of strong coffee. Finish dry-malty. Heavy beer!
On tap at Harrys Hofbrau. Roast, coffee, cream and chocolate marry well. Clear brown with tan head. Complex, rich malt. Roasted coffee. Dry finish. Wow - Excellent.

Draught @ CBC 2014 [ Red Session ]. - Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014, Sparta Hallen, Gunnar Nu Hansens Plads 11, 2100 Copenhagen, Denmark [ As Green Flash Ristretto Cosmic Black Lager ].Clear dark black brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, peppery, moderate chocolate, ash notes. Flavour is heavy sweet and moderate to heavy bitter with a long duration, dark roasted, wood, ash. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20140503]

On tap @ Haven Gastropub. Black pour with a khaki head. Smells of roasted malt, licorice, coffee, and brûléed sugar. Nice herbal hops and a touch of raisin. Some oatmeal cookie, too. Flavor has a decent bitterness. But, quite a bit of dark and burnt sugar sweetness. Licorice candies, coffee, and some dark fruits. Kind of earthy and herbal on the finish. Good, but more porter than Schwarzbier.
Draft at stone. Garnet with a dark, tan head. Huge coffee aromas. Like drinking an amazing espresso.

Sample @ CBC 2014.Pours black with a creamy brown head. Aroma is deep espresso, light sweet biscuity malt and light hoppy. Taste is light/medium sweet malty with a dense roasted coffee, dry coffee bitterness in the finish.

On tap at Lupulo in Santa Cruz. Pours darkest brown with a sticky tan head. Gorgeous mocha aroma, chocolate graham crackers and sweetened coffee. Flavor is smooth sweet coffee, dark chocolate, mocha with no cream. Perfumey chocolate syrup finish. Nice stuff, best thing Green Flash has done in ages.
CBC. Clear very dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt and chocolate. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and roasted moderate bitter finish. 030514
On tap at CBC 2014. Dark brown with small tan head. Aroma roasted, burnt, lots of coffee. Taste has coffee, smooth and silky, roasted malt with a soft mouthfeel. Nice

Draught @ CBC2014. Pours near black with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted, licorice, heavy toasted malts, green hops, caramel, jenka, sweet coffee. Body is medium+, texture is oily, carbonation is moderate. Finishes dry, bitter and toasted.

3rd May 2014CBC Session 3. Opaque black - brown beer, small pale tan head. Palate is smooth and light. Very modest fine carbonation. Mellow smooth espresso with a nice touch of light malt cream. Mild dried fruits provide another dimension. Finishes light and dry. Well joined up and tasty.
Draught at CBC 2014. Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, caramel, coffee and chocolate.

Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014. 3rd Session. Pours black to brown with a beige head, aroma of coffee, chocolate, vanilla and caramel, flavor is bitter with some metal notes and chocolate, medium bodied. nice
Draught at CBC 2014. Clear brown - offwhite head. Roasted, high malty, burned malts, dryness, herbal, some coffee, light ryebread, nice bitterness.
Draft @ CBC 2014. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty coffee aroma with hints of caramel. Roasted malty caramel and coffee flavor. Has a roasted malty coffee finish.
From tap. Pours hazy brown with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted malty and breadish, dry malty and caramelish. Smooth roasted malty, toffee and caramelish. Mild bitter and toasted malty finish.
Tap @ CBC14-red. lack. Dark chocolate coffee nose, schwarzer tones. Full soft smooth body. Really lovely roasty, going towards espresso beanyness. Really nice, probably the best schwarz Ive had.
[5/3/14] Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration. 3rd session. Dark brown with a tan head. Nice roasty coffee aroma. Bittersweet flavor with lots of coffee. Rounded mouthfeel. Very nice.

Taster, on tap, session no. 3, Copenhagen Beer Celebration. Fair tan-coloured head to a deep, dark brown coloured body. Espresso aroma, roasted. Pleasant taste profile of coffee, earth, liquorice and dark chocolate leading to a welcoming, long-lived roasted finish. Medium bodied. Well-made version of the style (03.05.2014).

Sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014. Black with a short tan-coloured head. Coffee jumps out instantly on the nose. Roasted taste with bitterness from the coffee. Im not always a fan of coffee beers but this is done exceptionally well.
Draught CBC 2014. Black coloured. Dense light brown head. Aroma. Roast, coffee, chocolate. Flavour. Cofffe, roast, herbs, chocolate, some sweetness. Medium to full bodied. Ends Roasted bitter.

Draft at CBC 2014. Pours black with a small beige head. Aroma of roasted coffee and malt. Taste is of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate and sugar. Medium body and carbonation. Really good coffee flavours in the aftertaste.
AT CBC. Black colour with tan head. Coffee, roasted aroma. Roasted, coffee, chocolate taste, slightly sweet. Light to medium body.

Draught at CBC 2014.
Pitch black coloured with a small beige head.
Sweet and rioasted aroma of caramel, coffee and chocolate.
Sweet and roasted flavour of caramel, chocolate and coffee.
Roasted finish.

Draught @ CBC 2014. Pours dark brown with a light brown head. Aroma of roaste malt, coffee, burnt caramel. Flavor is roasted malt, coffee, caramel, dry. Thin to medium body, soft carboantion, dry light bitter finish. 030514

CBC 2014. Pours black with a low tan head. Aromas of roasted malts, brown sugar, chocolate, coffee. Taste is coffee, chocolate, brown sugar, honey. Mouthfeel is smooth with medium carbonation. Aftertaste is coffee and chocolate with some caramel tones.

Tap @ CBC, 14. Very dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee and caramel. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, caramel, medium sweet, liquorice and a little bitter.

Tap @CBC2014
Dark brown color, small steady brownish head. Coffee and dark caramel in the nose. Light-bodied. Caramel, toffee, some metal, cold coffee and light hops. Sweetish aftertaste. Not really my kind of beer.

Tap @ CBC14.
Pours dark brown color with a small head. Aroma of coffee, roasted malts, caramel and some grainy notes. Flavor of caramel malts, coffee, toffee and some cocoa notes. Nice and fairly simple.
4414

Draught @ CBC 2014

Pours pitch black with a smooth white head. Aroma of roasty malts, coffee, espresso and grassy hops. Taste is roasty, smooth and chocolatey with loads of coffee and espresso. Finish is roasty with loads of coffee. Quite a coffee & espresso overdose.

Pours dark brown with low light tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate, coffee, roasted chocolate malts. Taste is chocolate sweet followed by light dark chocolate bitter, very balanced. Body is light and smooth with soft carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2014 
Draught @ CBC14
Aroma has hayish coffee tones, some licorice and roastiness. Flavour is hoppy with licorice, coffee and some salmiac. Rich and nice, the best schwartz Ive had. Not the most typical though...
Tap at the Copenhagen beer... Dark black... Thin tan lacing... Soft chocolate roast malt nose... Dark roast.. Sweet roast... Ligt pine... Light charcoal.. Mellow roast nice

Draught at Stone World Bistro Liberty Station, San Diego. Black beer with a nice beige head. Lovely coffee and espresso aroma, dark chocolate, cocoa powder, vanilla, some cream. Coffee flavor, vanilla, cream, licorice, espresso, milk chocolate, caramel, licorice, roasted, some fruity notes. Really nice if you like coffee.

Black sasparilla body with a caramel-brown head. Lovely chocolate espresso bean nose. Rich, deep, robust chocolate espresso bean flavor--quite powerful. A bit of bitter coffee grounds on the finish. A robust, puissant beer, but superbly executed.

Pours pitch black with some brown hues on the edges win anyone finger tab head with nice lacing. Aroma is of espresso, dark chocolate, roasted malts, sweet malts, caramel, and molasses. Taste is of espresso, dark chocolate, roasted malts, molasses, and caramel. Has a medium body with a semi creamy mouthfeel and a slighty dry, medium finish. Overall, a tasty, drinkable schwarzbier, that has a lot of nice Cofee notes.

Black with a super resilient, heavily lacing, mocha colored head . Mild aroma of roast and dark chocolate. Nice roasty flavor with mild elements of dark chocolate and coffee. Definitely including the associated bitterness. Creamy medium body thats a little dry. Solid.

Pours black. Bubbly tan, oily head. Aroma of dark roast and some coffee. Mostly strong coffee flavor with a little bit of milk. The beer comes off as refreshing on the palate with a fizzing texture and airy finish. Minimal aftertaste for having such a strong coffee flavor.

On tap at the brewery. Black in color with a decent sized cream colored head. Aroma is of chocolate, espresso, roasted malts, light note of toffee, and cocoa. Taste is of espresso blending to rich dark chocolate, bitter roasted malts and light smoke in the finish. Well crafted.
